gameDescription: Two futuristic airships, the Gaia Guardian and Fauna Saviour, are tasked with an unprecedented eco-mission - to transport rescued Pangolins from Africa to a purpose-built facility in Vietnam. Each decision made by the crews affects not just the success of the mission but the survival of the world's most trafficked mammal.

setting.location: From the heart of Africa to Vietnam

blueTeam.name: Gaia Guardian
blueTeam.description: Specializing in navigation through challenging and rough weather conditions.

redTeam.name: Fauna Saviour
redTeam.description: Experts in swift and safe animal transport, with a focus on conservation.

turns.scenario: Conflict erupts near the pickup point. This could hinder the mission's timing and compromise safety. Each team must decide on their approach.

options.A: Wait out the conflict, ensuring safety but delaying the mission.
options.B: Call in a peacekeeping force to quell the conflict and proceed with the mission.

AA.narrative: Both teams chose safety over haste. While conflicts cooled down, they maintained their location without risking the pangolins' stress levels. Patience rewarded, the mission continues.

AB.narrative: Gaia Guardian opts for the peaceful wait, while Fauna Saviour calls in the peacekeepers. The quick intervention saves time, but stresses the pangolins - a reminder of operational dilemmas.

BA.narrative: Team roles reverse as Fauna Saviour waits out the conflict while Gaia Guardian brings in peacekeepers. Intervention brings a swift, if stressful, solution. The mission proceeds with mindful vigilance.

BB.narrative: Teams call in peacekeepers, resolving the conflict quickly. Despite stressing the pangolins, time is saved. A reminder of tough decisions in the harsh realities of conservation missions.

turns.scenario: A message arrives about another group of illegally captured pangolins; they can be saved with a significant detour.

options.A: Stick to the original route, focusing on those already rescued.
options.B: Take the detour to save the additional group of pangolins, pressing fuel efficiency.

AA.narrative: Sticking to the original route, both teams commit to the pangolins onboard. An agonizing decision, but their mission continues on course.

AB.narrative: Gaia Guardian holds course, while Fauna Saviour veers for the rescue. They save more pangolins but at a major fuel cost. Singular focus versus extemporaneous rescue - a governing conundrum in wildlife conservation.

BA.narrative: Fauna Saviour stays the course, Gaia Guardian rescues more pangolins. Choices like these paint a vivid image of the challenges in conservation missions - strict plans against unforeseen contingencies.

BB.narrative: Taking the detour, both teams rescue additional pangolins. They push fuel efficiency to the edge - a stark message about the lengths necessary in wildlife preservation.

turns.scenario: Approaching the Vietnamese coast, air traffic congestion presents a challenge. Teams must decide how to handle this final hurdle.

options.A: Accelerate to a higher altitude course for a swift descent once past congestion.
options.B: Maintain current altitude, navigating slower but with better control.

AA.narrative: Both teams loft higher, surmounting the congestion and making a swift descent, stretching fuel efficiency to their limits but ensuring the earliest possible arrival for the pangolins at their sanctuary.

AB.narrative: While Gaia Guardian ascends, Fauna Saviour sticks to its altitude, plotting a methodical course. This results in a divergent path - a thrilling end to an epic journey.

BA.narrative: Fauna Saviour climbs in altitude, while Gaia Guardian persists at its current path. The pangolins, despite the diverse routes, forge ahead towards their safe haven.

BB.narrative: Both teams maintain current altitude, meticulously picking a path through congestion whilst conserving fuel and offering the pangolins a smooth ride. They reach the facility, marking a triumphant end to their perilous journey.
